title: Heating Your Home Is Expensive and Carbon Heavy. Will Heat Pumps Help?
sub_head: Devices that use warmth from ground or air to heat homes could help cut household emissions
body:
As consumers and governments aim to reduce their carbon footprints, heat pumps are growing in popularity as a way to cut emissions associated with the way we heat our homes.
Heating air and water for buildings was responsible for 12% of the worldâ€™s energy-related carbon emissions in 2019, according to the International Energy Agency, roughly half the amount produced by the entire global transportation sector.
